project.name: Yachtielink
project.one_line: A crew-first identity and trust layer for yachting, built to survive incentive pressure.
project.north_star: Build durable free identity infrastructure first, fund it via paid presentation upgrades and recruiter access, and activate trust only once incentives are stable.

version_history.summary: Added phase execution spec, refined yacht graph rules
PM handover: added actionables, handover notes, expanded decisions and glossary
Added moderation and consensus mechanics documentation
Added CV import feature for onboarding (D-021)
Added peer hiring feature - free job posts with graph-aware applications (D-022). Revised non-goal from 'not a job marketplace' to 'not an employer-pays hiring platform'.

Major monetisation update: Crew Pro tier with search (D-023), recruiter access model with subscription + credits (D-024), contextual profile visibility (D-025), endorsement sorting for recruiters (D-026), availability toggle with expiry (D-027). Three revenue streams: Crew Pro €12/mo, Recruiter subscription €29/mo, Recruiter credits €75-1200.

handoff.update_rule: Append-only updates after v1.0; do not silently rewrite history. New decisions require new entries in yl_decisions.vNext.json.

observed_failures: Crew trust signals exist informally (dock talk, WhatsApp, Facebook) and decay quickly
Bad actors can move between yachts with little persistent signal
Strong crew lack portable, verifiable proof beyond CVs and references
Agencies and management have incentive conflicts with truth-seeking
Sharing negative information is risky and coercion-prone
problem_definition.root_issue: The industry lacks a neutral system where identity and trust signals can accumulate safely over time with aligned incentives.

canonical_rules.monetisation: You can't pay to be more trusted. You can only pay to present yourself better.
interpretation: Credibility is never gated by payment
Access to search may be monetised (recruiters pay for discovery, not influence)

crew_pro.target: Active crew, especially those who hire (captains, HODs)

recruiter_subscription.includes: Dashboard access, required for credit usage

phase_invariants: Phase 1 schemas persist into Phases 2 and 3
If incentives threaten trust, the system freezes rather than bends
Recruiters have read-only access — they cannot influence the graph
Graph edges are created only by colleagues and IRL connections
Contacts never affect graph or trust
Timeline ordering is chronological only (no algorithmic surfacing)

relationship_model.colleague: Graph edge created by overlapping yacht or company employment
relationship_model.irl_connection: Graph edge created by verified in-person interaction
relationship_model.contact: Messaging + timeline post visibility only; no graph impact
relationship_model.graph_invariant: Graph edges = colleagues + IRL connections only

visibility.interactions_public: Visible to colleagues and IRL connections only
visibility.milestones: Network by default, hideable per item
